title: Aten Incompatible with CUDA 10 and RTX 20xx series graphic cards
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Aten Incompatible with CUDA 10 and RTX 20xx series graphic cards, poping errors like below:

ptxas warning : Value of threads per SM for entry ... is out of range. .minnctapersm will be ignored

This is likely due to the architectural change of the new GPUs.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:

  1. install NVIDIA Driver 410 and CUDA 10
  2. git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git
  3. TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.5 python setup.py install

Expected behaviour

Expect to build successfully but in reality, it pops tons of warnings like above, and those warnings do make pytorch not working properly.

Note: TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.0 runs smothly while TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.5 does not.

Environment

PyTorch version: 1.0.0a0+b26f82b
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 10.0.130

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.3.0-27ubuntu1~18.04) 7.3.0
CMake version: version 3.12.2

Python version: 3.7
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 10.0.130
GPU models and configuration:
GPU 0: GeForce RTX 2080
GPU 1: GeForce RTX 2080

Nvidia driver version: 410.73
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.3.1
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.15.1)
[pip] numpydoc (0.8.0)
[pip] torch (1.0.0a0+b26f82b)
[pip] torchvision-nightly (0.2.1)
[conda] torch 1.0.0a0+b26f82b
[conda] torchvision-nightly 0.2.1

Additional context

Note: TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.0 runs smothly while TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.5 does not.

body:
## 🐛 Bug
Aten Incompatible with CUDA 10 and RTX 20xx series graphic cards, poping errors like below:

`ptxas warning : Value of threads per SM for entry ... is out of range. .minnctapersm will be ignored`

This is likely due to the architectural change of the new GPUs.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:

1. install NVIDIA Driver 410 and CUDA 10
1. git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git
1. TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.5 python setup.py install

<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well -->

## Expected behaviour

Expect to build successfully but in reality, it pops tons of warnings like above, and those warnings do make pytorch not working properly.

Note: TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.0 runs smothly while TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.5 does not.

## Environment
PyTorch version: 1.0.0a0+b26f82b
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 10.0.130

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.3.0-27ubuntu1~18.04) 7.3.0
CMake version: version 3.12.2

Python version: 3.7
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 10.0.130
GPU models and configuration: 
GPU 0: GeForce RTX 2080
GPU 1: GeForce RTX 2080

Nvidia driver version: 410.73
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.3.1
/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.15.1)
[pip] numpydoc (0.8.0)
[pip] torch (1.0.0a0+b26f82b)
[pip] torchvision-nightly (0.2.1)
[conda] torch                     1.0.0a0+b26f82b           <pip>
[conda] torchvision-nightly       0.2.1                     <pip>

## Additional context
Note: TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.0 runs smothly while TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=7.5 does not.
